content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 4): The ringgit opened lower against the US dollar on Tuesday (Jan 4) on better demand for the greenback as US Treasury yields increased.

At 9am, the local currency was traded at 4.1795/1825 against the greenback from 4.1715/1740 at Monday’s close.

According to news reports, the rise in the US yields was a sign that the US dollar could extend last year’s rally as markets anticipate that the US Federal Reserve would initiate a cycle of interest-rate increases this year.
